header.title: Grovelling Apology: Advertising boss sorry for sexist email ranking female colleagues
header.subtitle: AN ADVERTISING boss has apologised after sending an email around the office ranking female colleagues by their looks on International Women’s Day. Paul Martin’s derogatory message included lists such as a “top five”, “bottom five” and “if I’d had a few too many”.
header.postText: He also made crude comments about staff, saying of one colleague: “If you were the last girl on earth, I would use you as bait to trap a wild animal I would be happier *******”.', 'Mr Martin sent the email as he prepared to leave his role at advertising agency The&Partnership in London.', 'He has now issued a grovelling apology after the message was leaked on social media, insisting it was only a joke.', 'He said: “I take full and sole responsibility for this and sincerely apologise for all offence this has caused. This absolutely wasn’t my intention and I am incredibly sorry.', '“The email was meant to be a stupid, ironic attempt to subvert and mock the sexist ‘top five’ emails that have been sent around agencies for many years but I have totally missed the mark and take full responsibility. All the women mentioned in it are friends and people I very genuinely love.”', 'Mr Martin said he had donated to the Time’s Up Legal Defence Fund and apologised to each of the women named on the email.', 'The&Partnership said in a statement: “We do not condone sexism of any kind. We’ve apologised to our staff and others for any offence this email has caused.”
